skill.name: chembl-database
skill.description: Query ChEMBL's bioactive molecules and drug discovery data. Search compounds by structure/properties, retrieve bioactivity data (IC50, Ki), find inhibitors, perform SAR studies, for medicinal chemistry.
skill.summary: Query ChEMBL's bioactive molecules and drug discovery data. Search compounds by structure/properties...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation and reference library for querying the official ChEMBL database via the chembl_webresource_client Python library. It makes API calls to the legitimate EBI domain and has no file system access beyond its own directory. No environment variable reading or external command execution detected.

low_findings.title: External network API calls
low_findings.description: The skill makes HTTP requests to the ChEMBL API at ebi.ac.uk through the chembl_webresource_client library. This is expected behavior for a database query skill and the endpoint is legitimate.

content.value_statement: Finding drug discovery data requires searching multiple databases and understanding complex API queries. This skill provides ready-to-use functions for querying ChEMBL's database of over 2 million bioactive compounds, 19 million bioactivity measurements, and approved drug information.
actual_capabilities: Query molecules by ChEMBL ID, name, or property filters
Search biological targets by name, type, or organism
Retrieve bioactivity data including IC50, Ki, EC50 measurements
Perform similarity and substructure searches by SMILES
Get drug information, mechanisms, and clinical indications
Export results to pandas DataFrames for analysis
limitations: Rate limited by ChEMBL fair usage policies
Cannot modify or write data back to ChEMBL database

use_cases.title: Find inhibitors for targets
use_cases.description: Identify potent kinase inhibitors by querying bioactivity data filtered by IC50 values under 100 nM

use_cases.title: Explore drug repurposing
use_cases.description: Look up approved drugs and find their target mechanisms, indications, and bioactivity profiles

use_cases.title: SAR study workflows
use_cases.description: Find similar compounds by structure and analyze how molecular properties correlate with activity

best_practices: Use caching to minimize repeated API calls and respect ChEMBL rate limits
Filter by molecular properties like MW and LogP to find drug-like compounds
Convert results to pandas DataFrames for statistical analysis
anti_patterns: Making rapid consecutive requests without implementing rate limiting
Ignoring data validity flags and potential duplicate markers in results
Forgetting to check units (nM, uM) when comparing bioactivity values

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: The ChEMBL skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires Python with the chembl_webresource_client library installed.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for ChEMBL API?
faq.answer: ChEMBL enforces fair usage policies. Use caching, batch requests, and avoid rapid consecutive queries to stay within limits.

faq.question: How do I install the required library?
faq.answer: Run: uv pip install chembl_webresource_client. Optionally install pandas for data export with: pip install pandas.

faq.question: Is my data safe when querying ChEMBL?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads data from ChEMBL. No data is written or transmitted to third-party servers beyond the official EBI endpoints.

faq.question: Why are my query results empty?
faq.answer: Check your filter parameters. Ensure ChEMBL IDs are correct format (CHEMBL followed by numbers). Verify units like nM match the data.

faq.question: How does this compare to PubChem or DrugBank?
faq.answer: ChEMBL focuses on drug-like bioactive molecules with curated bioactivity data. It excels for structure-activity relationship studies compared to broader chemical databases.
